speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: SCENE III. Bohemia. A desert country near the sea.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Enter ANTIGONUS with a Child, and a Mariner

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Thou art perfect then, our ship hath touch'd upon

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: The deserts of Bohemia?

speaker: Mariner
text_entry: Ay, my lord: and fear

speaker: Mariner
text_entry: We have landed in ill time: the skies look grimly

speaker: Mariner
text_entry: And threaten present blusters. In my conscience,

speaker: Mariner
text_entry: The heavens with that we have in hand are angry

speaker: Mariner
text_entry: And frown upon 's.

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Their sacred wills be done! Go, get aboard;

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Look to thy bark: I'll not be long before

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: I call upon thee.

speaker: Mariner
text_entry: Make your best haste, and go not

speaker: Mariner
text_entry: Too far i' the land: 'tis like to be loud weather;

speaker: Mariner
text_entry: Besides, this place is famous for the creatures

speaker: Mariner
text_entry: Of prey that keep upon't.

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Go thou away:

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: I'll follow instantly.

speaker: Mariner
text_entry: I am glad at heart

speaker: Mariner
text_entry: To be so rid o' the business.

speaker: Mariner
text_entry: Exit

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Come, poor babe:

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: I have heard, but not believed,

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: the spirits o' the dead

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: May walk again: if such thing be, thy mother

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Appear'd to me last night, for ne'er was dream

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: So like a waking. To me comes a creature,

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Sometimes her head on one side, some another;

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: I never saw a vessel of like sorrow,

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: So fill'd and so becoming: in pure white robes,

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Like very sanctity, she did approach

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: My cabin where I lay; thrice bow'd before me,

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: And gasping to begin some speech, her eyes

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Became two spouts: the fury spent, anon

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Did this break-from her: 'Good Antigonus,

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Since fate, against thy better disposition,

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Hath made thy person for the thrower-out

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Of my poor babe, according to thine oath,

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Places remote enough are in Bohemia,

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: There weep and leave it crying; and, for the babe

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Is counted lost for ever, Perdita,

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: I prithee, call't. For this ungentle business

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Put on thee by my lord, thou ne'er shalt see

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Thy wife Paulina more.' And so, with shrieks

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: She melted into air. Affrighted much,

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: I did in time collect myself and thought

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: This was so and no slumber. Dreams are toys:

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Yet for this once, yea, superstitiously,

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: I will be squared by this. I do believe

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Hermione hath suffer'd death, and that

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Apollo would, this being indeed the issue

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Of King Polixenes, it should here be laid,

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Either for life or death, upon the earth

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Of its right father. Blossom, speed thee well!

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: There lie, and there thy character: there these;

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Which may, if fortune please, both breed thee, pretty,

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: And still rest thine. The storm begins; poor wretch,

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: That for thy mother's fault art thus exposed

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: To loss and what may follow! Weep I cannot,

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: But my heart bleeds; and most accursed am I

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: To be by oath enjoin'd to this. Farewell!

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: The day frowns more and more: thou'rt like to have

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: A lullaby too rough: I never saw

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: The heavens so dim by day. A savage clamour!

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Well may I get aboard! This is the chase:

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: I am gone for ever.

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Exit, pursued by a bear

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Enter a Shepherd

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: I would there were no age between sixteen and

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: three-and-twenty, or that youth would sleep out the

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: rest; for there is nothing in the between but

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: getting wenches with child, wronging the ancientry,

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: stealing, fighting--Hark you now! Would any but

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: these boiled brains of nineteen and two-and-twenty

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: hunt this weather? They have scared away two of my

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: best sheep, which I fear the wolf will sooner find

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: than the master: if any where I have them, 'tis by

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: the seaside, browsing of ivy. Good luck, an't be thy

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: will what have we here! Mercy on 's, a barne a very

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: pretty barne! A boy or a child, I wonder? A

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: pretty one; a very pretty one: sure, some 'scape:

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: though I am not bookish, yet I can read

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: waiting-gentlewoman in the 'scape. This has been

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: some stair-work, some trunk-work, some

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: behind-door-work: they were warmer that got this

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: than the poor thing is here. I'll take it up for

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: pity: yet I'll tarry till my son come; he hallooed

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: but even now. Whoa, ho, hoa!

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Enter Clown

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Hilloa, loa!

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: What, art so near? If thou'lt see a thing to talk

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: on when thou art dead and rotten, come hither. What

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: ailest thou, man?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I have seen two such sights, by sea and by land!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: but I am not to say it is a sea, for it is now the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: sky: betwixt the firmament and it you cannot thrust

speaker: Clown
text_entry: a bodkin's point.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Why, boy, how is it?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I would you did but see how it chafes, how it rages,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: how it takes up the shore! but that's not the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: point. O, the most piteous cry of the poor souls!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: sometimes to see 'em, and not to see 'em; now the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: ship boring the moon with her main-mast, and anon

speaker: Clown
text_entry: swallowed with yest and froth, as you'ld thrust a

speaker: Clown
text_entry: cork into a hogshead. And then for the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: land-service, to see how the bear tore out his

speaker: Clown
text_entry: shoulder-bone; how he cried to me for help and said

speaker: Clown
text_entry: his name was Antigonus, a nobleman. But to make an

speaker: Clown
text_entry: end of the ship, to see how the sea flap-dragoned

speaker: Clown
text_entry: it: but, first, how the poor souls roared, and the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: sea mocked them; and how the poor gentleman roared

speaker: Clown
text_entry: and the bear mocked him, both roaring louder than

speaker: Clown
text_entry: the sea or weather.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Name of mercy, when was this, boy?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Now, now: I have not winked since I saw these

speaker: Clown
text_entry: sights: the men are not yet cold under water, nor

speaker: Clown
text_entry: the bear half dined on the gentleman: he's at it

speaker: Clown
text_entry: now.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Would I had been by, to have helped the old man!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I would you had been by the ship side, to have

speaker: Clown
text_entry: helped her: there your charity would have lacked footing.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Heavy matters! heavy matters! but look thee here,

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: boy. Now bless thyself: thou mettest with things

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: dying, I with things newborn. Here's a sight for

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: thee; look thee, a bearing-cloth for a squire's

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: child! look thee here; take up, take up, boy;

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: open't. So, let's see: it was told me I should be

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: rich by the fairies. This is some changeling:

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: open't. What's within, boy?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: You're a made old man: if the sins of your youth

speaker: Clown
text_entry: are forgiven you, you're well to live. Gold! all gold!

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: This is fairy gold, boy, and 'twill prove so: up

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: with't, keep it close: home, home, the next way.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: We are lucky, boy; and to be so still requires

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: nothing but secrecy. Let my sheep go: come, good

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: boy, the next way home.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Go you the next way with your findings. I'll go see

speaker: Clown
text_entry: if the bear be gone from the gentleman and how much

speaker: Clown
text_entry: he hath eaten: they are never curst but when they

speaker: Clown
text_entry: are hungry: if there be any of him left, I'll bury

speaker: Clown
text_entry: it.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: That's a good deed. If thou mayest discern by that

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: which is left of him what he is, fetch me to the

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: sight of him.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Marry, will I; and you shall help to put him i' the ground.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: 'Tis a lucky day, boy, and we'll do good deeds on't.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Exeunt
